d:OperatorScript.p: Test the 'direction' and 'unicode-bidi' properties, which are important for internationalized text. A string of text is shown three times. The string starts with the English word "Test" followed by a Hebrew phrase, in quotes, followed by the English phrase "is in Hebrew".(Hebrew is normally written left to right). The first logical letter in the Hebrew is aleph, "א" and the last in logical order is yud, "י".
The test is passed if the three strings are displayed with the ordering described below.

In the first (uppermost) subtest, the direction and unicode-bidi properties are used to force the entire string to be displayed left to right. Thus the English portions are in the noral left to right order but the Hebrew portion is displayed in an unusual left to right order, placing the first character aleph, "א" closest to "Text" and the last character yud, "י" closest to "is in Hebrew".

In the second (middle) subtest, the direction and unicode-bidi properties are used to force the entire string to be displayed left to right. Thus the English portions are in the unusual right to left order (so "Text" appears as "txeT", "is in Hebrew" as "werbeH ni si") but the Hebrew portion is displayed in the usual right to left order, again placing the first character aleph, "א" closest to "txeT" and the last character yud, "י" closest to "werbeH ni si".

In the third (lowest) subtest, the direction and unicode-bidi properties are explicitly set to their initial values. The string to thus displayed with the expected directionality for each language: the English portions are in the normal left to right order and the Hebrew portion is in the normal right to left order, placing the last character, yud, "י" closest to "Text" and the first character aleph, "א", closest to "is in Hebrew".

An SVG font is provided for the Hebrew letters, so there is no reliance on Hebrew fonts being available on the test platform. The text anchor position is indicated by a small red dot. The second subtest has the text-anchor property set to 'end' as the text is forced to be right to left.

g.text: Text "אני יכול לאכול זכוכית וזה לא מזיק לי" is in Hebrew
Text "אני יכול לאכול זכוכית וזה לא מזיק לי" is in Hebrew
Text "אני יכול לאכול זכוכית וזה לא מזיק לי" is in Hebrew
